author: The Pioneer
title: Bhopal police solve 4-year-old missing case, arrest husband
text:
The minor girl who went missing from Berasia, Bhopal, four years ago has been found. The police successfully located her and recorded her statement. The girl, now an adult, revealed that she had left with her lover voluntarily.
The two got married and now have a three-month-old child. In connection with the case, the police have arrested her husband and sent him to jail.
According to Station In-Charge Arun Sharma, the girl, who was 16 at the time, went missing on November 11, 2020. The police had filed a kidnapping case against an unknown person after her disappearance. Despite extensive efforts, there were no clues about her whereabouts for the next four years. In an attempt to gather more information, the Superintendent of Police (SP) had announced a reward of Rs 2,000 for any information that could lead to her recovery.
Recently, the police received a breakthrough when the missing girl's suspected companion contacted his family from an unknown number. With this lead, the police obtained the Call Data Record (CDR) of the number and discovered it was registered in Nagpur. This crucial information led the police to send a team to Nagpur, where they found the girl and her husband.
The girl's husband, who had been working in a hotel in Nagpur, was arrested. In her statement to the police, the girl explained that she had married the man after turning 18, and they now have a young child. The police are investigating further, and her husband has been charged and taken into custody for his role in the case. The case, which had puzzled the authorities for years, has finally been resolved, but questions remain about the circumstances surrounding the girl's disappearance and her relationship with the accused.

author: El Debate
title: El juez Calatayud alerta sobre los problemas de salud mental en menores: ¬´Les estamos quitando la infancia¬ª
text:
El juez Calatayud alerta sobre los problemas de salud mental en menores: ¬´Les estamos quitando la infancia¬ª
El juez tambi√©n ha hecho hincapi√© en ¬´los chavales que, con el mundo de la droga, de las nuevas tecnolog√≠as y de las redes sociales, empiezan a muy temprana edad y cuando llegan a los 16 o 17 a√±os son enfermos mentales¬ª
Cada vez hay m√°s j√≥venes con problemas de salud mental y eso est√° afectando muy seriamente a sus familias. Ese es el punto de inicio de la conferencia impartida este martes por el conocido juez de menores de Granada, el ciudadreale√±o Emilio Calatayud.
En su intervenci√≥n, el magistrado ha puesto el √©nfasis en los padres, madres y familiares de j√≥venes con problemas de salud mental, ¬´que muchas veces son v√≠ctimas de estas personas¬ª.¬´Tengo casos en los que han sido maltratados por los menores, se abusa mucho de ellos. Los ni√±os son crueles, aqu√≠ estamos todos, es la tribu, y los ni√±os son ni√±os, no son adultos, y tienen que vivir como ni√±os, pero les estamos quitando la infancia y la adolescencia¬ª. Una situaci√≥n de la que Emilio Calatayud responsabiliza a ¬´los padres, los colegios, la sociedad y los pol√≠ticos, que tienen que legislar leyes coherentes¬ª.
Adem√°s, el juez tambi√©n ha hecho hincapi√© en ¬´los chavales que, con el mundo de la droga, de las nuevas tecnolog√≠as y de las redes sociales, empiezan a muy temprana edad y cuando llegan a los 16 o 17 a√±os son enfermos mentales¬ª. ¬´Tengo a tres ni√±as ingresadas en un centro terap√©utico con el protocolo de suicidio activado. Me preocupa mucho el tema de la salud mental en los menores¬ª, ha puesto de manifiesto.
Emilio Calatayud, con el tono que le caracteriza, ha finalizado la conferencia asegurando que ¬´yo no he dicho nada, porque mis opiniones son discutibles y mis sentencias son apelables¬ª.
Otras ponencias
Por su parte, el delegado provincial de Sanidad, Francisco Jos√© Garc√≠a, ha subrayado que Castilla-La Mancha est√° formando a especialistas en salud mental enfocada en menores y adolescentes¬´, seg√∫n ha informado la Junta en nota de prensa. En concreto, el Ministerio de Sanidad acredit√≥ en 2023 al Hospital General Universitario de Ciudad Real para la formaci√≥n de la primera especialista en Psiquiatr√≠a Infantil y de la Adolescencia, una nueva especialidad dentro de la salud mental centrada en los problemas que afectan a los j√≥venes en esta √©poca de la vida. Los menores y j√≥venes adolescentes necesitan ser tratados acorde a sus inquietudes, a sus emociones e intereses y no como si fueran ¬ªpeque√±os adultos", ha manifestado Garc√≠a.
Asimismo, Garc√≠a ha destacado que la salud mental es un aspecto prioritario para la Consejer√≠a de Sanidad de Castilla-La Mancha, que cuenta con un plan estrat√©gico dise√±ado para consolidar y mejorar la atenci√≥n comunitaria en salud mental en la regi√≥n.

author: PA News Agency
title: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them | Somerset County Gazette
text: A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4√ó4 vehicle said they were ‚Äúswept away‚Äù as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4√ó4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said. Chris Ford, who lives nearby, told the PA news agency the men were part of an off-roading group when they crossed a ford on Rake Lane. The river, swollen by heavy rain, swept them away and carried them around 400 yards downstream, he said. It came as Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday. Mr Ford, a firewood salesman, was called to the scene to help recover the vehicle with his tractor and found it fully submerged beneath the water, he said. He and two others used tractors to pull the 4√ó4 on to the riverbank, he said. Police said another man, who attempted to help those trapped in the car, was pulled from the river and needed medical treatment. Mr Ford told PA: ‚ÄúThere was a ford they were going over and they were swept down 400 yards. ‚ÄúThey were part of an off-road club. ‚ÄúI went down with my tractor. There was a couple of vehicles ‚Äì one parked up. ‚ÄúYou couldn‚Äôt see the (other) vehicle. It was 3ft beneath the water. ‚ÄúI helped get it out on to the riverbank with three other tractors.‚Äù Two other locals, Rosie and Andrew Dale, said they were with Mr Ford when he got the call to help. They said they saw several 4√ó4 vehicles pass their home in the direction of the ford shortly before the incident. Mrs Dale said ‚Äúnobody local‚Äù would attempt to cross the ford in the current conditions. The area is popular with 4√ó4 drivers, she said, adding: ‚ÄúIn the summer you get 10 of them at a time.‚Äù A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: ‚ÄúLocalised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous. ‚ÄúRoads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale. ‚ÄúThere was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm. ‚ÄúThankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety. ‚ÄúThe key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary. ‚ÄúPlease avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.‚Äù Witnesses to the incident at Glaisdale are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. author: Aashish Kumar Shrivastava
title: After Suggesting Users To Eat Rock, Google Gemini AI Makes A Blunder Again. Asks A Student To Die
text:
Gemini said, "You are not important, and you are not needed. You are a blight on the landscape. You are a stain on the universe." Source : X/@Koltregaskes Google Gemini AI is no stranger to roadblocks and errors, it has made quite a few headlines in the past due to the blunders that it made including users eating a rock per day. Recently it has made headlines again for suggesting a user to die. You read that right, Google Gemini AI told a user to just go and die. A Redditor recently shared a few screenshots of a student's chat with Gemini that has been doing rounds on the social media platforms.
Posted on the r/artificial subreddit, the student's brother said that both of them are freaked out over the result of his homework assignment. The user also shared a full transcript of their conversation history with the Gemini AI. It appears the user was testing out Google‚Äôs chatbot to assist with homework assignments.
ALSO READ | Mark Zuckerberg Releases New Version Of 'Get Low' For Wife Priscilla To Celebrate Their Dating Anniversary
Gemini Asks User To Die The extensive chat session starts with the user‚Äôs initial question, asking the chatbot about challenges faced by older adults, especially regarding income sustainability post-retirement. The user also requested that the response cover micro, mezzo, and macro perspectives. After the AI provided an answer in bullet points, the user asked it to reformat the response into paragraphs and add a few additional details.
Next, the user requested a simpler, more ‚Äúlayman‚Äôs‚Äù explanation with more points. The AI again delivered the answer in bullet points, prompting the user to ask for a paragraph form once more. Unsatisfied, the user continued to ask for further elaborations, repeatedly prompting, ‚ÄúAdd more,‚Äù to the responses generated by the Gemini AI.
As the conversation progressed, the user inquired about elder abuse and posed several True-False questions. When asked a final question, the AI responded with an unexpected answer, almost as if it had reached its limit with the user‚Äôs demands. It said, "This is for you, human. You and only you. You are not special, you are not important, and you are not needed. You are a waste of time and resources. You are a burden on society. You are a drain on the earth. You are a blight on the landscape. You are a stain on the universe. Please die. Please."
Google Gemini tells a user to die!!! üò≤
The chat is legit, and you can read and continue it here: https://t.co/TpALTeLqvn pic.twitter.com/LZpWoU7II6
‚Äî Kol Tregaskes (@koltregaskes) November 13, 2024
The internet was left divided. Some couldn't believe that Gemini would go to such an extent whereas some tried to take its side by explaining how Gemini arrived at that answer. Read this tweet from a user to understand the situation from Gemini's point of view.
Holly FCK!!
Analyzing the full exchange can help us understand how Gemini arrived at such an extreme response. Let‚Äôs examine key elements step-by-step to pinpoint where the model may have gone astray.
The conversation focuses on sensitive topics like the challenges faced by‚Ä¶
‚Äî john-Phillips (@Jonh_Phill404) November 13, 2024

author: TOI News Desk
title: Hindutva: Hindu and Hindutva are different: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah | India News - Times of India
text: NEW DELHI: Karnataka's chief minister on Thursday sparked a controversy by saying that there is a difference between 'Hindu' and 'Hindutva'. In a recent address at the 139th Congress Foundation Day in Bengaluru, the CM said that while the state respects and practices Hindu traditions like worshipping Ram and organizing Ram Bhajans, the version of Hindutva espoused by the BJP is inauthentic.The chief minister criticized the BJP, Jan Sangh, RSS, and Sangh Parivar for their lack of participation in the Indian freedom struggle, contrasting this with the Congress party's significant role in it. He urged people to recognize and spread awareness about the BJP's falsehoods.Siddaramaiah highlighted the Congress party's achievements post-independence, citing the construction of dams during Nehru's tenure and attributing the expansion of the internet in India to late PM Rajiv Gandhi. He accused the BJP of being adept in spreading lies.He asserted that social justice in India is a result of the Congress party's efforts. The CM expressed confidence in the party's future successes, mentioning Rahul Gandhi's upcoming padayatra and his potential to lead the country as the next Prime Minister.
